1: I’m so sorry to hear that!
2: I will continue to learn from experiences like this and strive to be more help in the future for you or future patients in a similar situation.
3: I went ahead and located some additional in-depth resources on this topic that may provide better detailed guidance for your issue.
4: [Patient Assistance Programs: What they are and how they can help you](https://cardioadmin.patientadvocate.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/It-Matters-Empowerment-Pathways-Patient-Assistance-Programs.pdf). Want to save money on medications? Here are some pointers on how to make the most of your money at the pharmacy
5: [Managing your pharmacy locations](https://cardioadmin.patientadvocate.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/It-Matters-Empowerment-Pathways-Managing-Your-Pharmacy-Locations.pdf). Includes tips on how to keep things straight between mail order, specialty, and retail pharmacies
6: [Exploring drug tiers and exceptions](https://cardioadmin.patientadvocate.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/It-Matters-Empowerment-Pathways-Exploring-Drug-Tiers-and-Exceptions.pdf). This handy reference guide will help break down your health plan’s coverage of medications
7: [What’s so special about specialty pharmacy?](https://cardioadmin.patientadvocate.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/It-Matters-Empowerment-Pathways-Whats-so-Special-About-a-Specialty-Pharmacy.pdf). Offers explanation on specialty pharmacies and how to navigate them
8: I wish you the best with your healthcare journey moving forward.
